name: Crown Metropol Melbourne

reviews.title: my new favourite melbourne hotel
reviews.text: Contemporary finishes, comfortable bed, extra soft bathrobes, ipod bedside clock/dock, amazing pool area.

reviews.title: fantastic hotel, great facilities
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Within easy walking distance to the CBD, restaurants and bars on Left Bank, Crown Metropol was a modern, minimalist, functional and very comfortable alternative to it's higher priced "sister" hotels within the Crown complex. Our room was quite large and the layout of bathroom etc made it appear even larger as the bathroom looks through to the room via a sliding partition that can be open or closed. All the mod-con's are available in the room - 42" HD LCD TV with plenty of cable channels, one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in for some time - quality sheets, even support mattress etc. Floor to ceiling windows affording a view down the river. The gym/spa/pool area on the 27th floor was well equiped. Many hotels don't pay much attention to the gym area, Crown Metropol has. Plenty of Life Fitness cardio and strength equipment available along with headphone jacks to access sound for the TV or music. Plenty of towels and water available and the view is again through floor to ceiling windows to help pass the time whilst exercising. The pool is quite large and 1.2m deep (4ft) so is good for swimming and for kids. It has an infinity edge and also looks out through floor to ceiling windows. Plenty of deck chairs available to lie on, though the sun is whatever comes in through the windows - this is not an open air pool. The spa/Jacuzzi is quite large and seats plenty and was a nice temp.

reviews.title: Would recommend
reviews.text: Just a quick review. Stayed here with my teenage daughter in a twin luxe room.
Very modern. As stated the bathroom is unusual but no a deal breaker.
reviews.title: Fabulous views from pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Likes: Current magazines in room, sizable floor plan, awesome pool and gym, Gordon Ramseys Maze was a treat.
reviews.title: Best Value for Money in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dislikes: Not too many. Just found the place a bit 'dark', trying to put on make up was difficult and I had to take the mirror near the window to get any good light. Really disliked being told to pay $45 to check into the room earlier, even though it was ready. Never had that one before and we travel world wide. A little too far out if your in Melbourne for a shopping trip but if you have business in the south end youll love it.
reviews.title: Modern Classy Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend if your into ultra modern decor.
reviews.title: Modern, clean, great location
Class, elegance but horrible pillows!
reviews.text: Stayed in the King room for four nights last week, and while everything was rather lovely, the pillow in my room were so uncomfortable I ended up using the throw cushions as pillows for most of my stay.

reviews.title: Modern and swanky, bad elevator experience
reviews.text: On the positive side of things, the staff were wonderful, especially in the Maza Grill where the coffee and toast was great. Everyone was friendly, and that extra bit of personal service really made a difference to a lonely business traveller.

reviews.title: A Couples Hotel not Triple/Quad Share
reviews.text: The pool and gym were amazing. I thought the gym was the best hotel gym I have been to. It was well equipt, clean and had great views over Melbourne. The steam room and plunge pool were also delicious after a hard day of meetings.

reviews.title: Great place to stay, excellent staff
reviews.text: I ordered room service on the first night and have to advise to eat elsewhere if possible. My meal was tiny and definitely didn't fill me up. It also took over an hour to arrive which wasn't great.

reviews.title: Vibey, sophisticated hotel
reviews.text: Over-all I think the hotel is enjoyable, and the small issues certainly didn't deter me from staying again in the future.

reviews.title: Excellent location and services
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Crown Metropol for three nights. We found the hotel to be excellently located. The staff were friendly and efficient. The pool on the 27th floor was a must!

reviews.title: Great hotel, highly recommended
reviews.text: Would recommend to anyone visiting Melbourne.

reviews.title: Will be hard to beat
reviews.text: Stayed at the Crown Metropol for 4 nights with husband.

reviews.title: A blend of comfort and style
reviews.text: Accommodation was of a high standard. Room really clean with great view. The pool and surrounding area was amazing. Spend hours sitting in the spa watching the hustle and bustle of the city below us.

reviews.title: Average hotel but great pool area
reviews.text: Great location, heaps of dining options within the Crown complex. The room was fine for the two of us but as already mentioned the open plan layout of the bathroom could be awkward.

description: Experience contemporary luxury in its purest form at Melbourne's Crown Metropol hotel.Your senses will be heightened with the many special touches that make every stay both relaxing and memorable. From the moment you take in the hotel's elegant form and enter the uniquely designed reception area, you will feel a sense of peace and calm that makes every visit to Crown Metropol a welcome escape from day-to-day life.- Winner of the Luxury Accommodation award at the RACV 2011 Victorian Tourism Awards.
